title-group.article-title: Effect of cation configuration and solvation on the band positions of zinc ferrite (100)

institution-wrap.institution: Mulliken Center for Theoretical Chemistry, Institute of Physical and Theoretical Chemistry

custom-meta.meta-value: European Photochemistry Association, European Society for Photobiology

notes.title: Supplementary Information
notes.p: The online version contains supplementary material available at https://doi.org/10.1007/s43630-022-00201-7.

sec.title: Introduction
sec.p: First, we will describe the computational details. Then we will commence with discussing our model, the stability of different cation distributions, their effect on band gap and band positions as well as the effect of implicit solvation on the latter.

sec.title: Computational details
Convergence tests
Surface models
Surface stability
Electronic properties
Comparison with flat band potentials
Summary and conclusion

ack.title: Acknowledgements
ack.p: We gratefully acknowledge financial support by the Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft within the priority program SPP 1613 ’Fuels Produced Regeneratively Through Light-Driven Water Splitting: Clarification of the Elemental Processes Involved and Prospects for Implementation in Technological Concepts’(BR 1768/9-1). The authors thank the Leibniz University of Hannover for providing computer time with LUIS and the University of Bonn for providing computer time on the Bonna cluster.

sec.title: Funding
sec.p: Open Access funding enabled and organized by Projekt DEAL.

sec.title: Conflict of interest
sec.p: The authors declare that they have no conflict of interest.
